ul.li1: 1“Call with the throat; you must not keep back!
ul.li2: lift up your voice like a trumpet,
ul.li1: and declareOr “announce” to my people their rebellion,
ul.li2: and to the house of Jacob their sins.
ul.li1: 2YetOr “And” they seek me day by day,
ul.li2: and they desire the knowledge of my ways
ul.li1: like a nation that practicedLiterally “did” righteousness,
ul.li2: and had not forsaken the judgment of its God;
ul.li1: they ask me for righteous judgments,Literally “judgments of righteousness”
ul.li2: they desire the closeness of God.
ul.li1: 3‘Why do we fast, and you do not see it?
ul.li2: We humiliate our soul, and you do not notice it?’
ul.li1: Look! You find delight on the day of your fast,
ul.li2: and you oppress all your workers!
ul.li1: 4Look! You fast to quarrel and strife,
ul.li2: and to strike with a wicked fist.Literally “fist of wickedness”
ul.li1: You shall not fast as you do today,Literally “the day”
ul.li2: to make your voice heardLiterally “cause to hear your voice” on the height.
ul.li1: 5Is the fast I choose like this,
ul.li2: a day for humankind to humiliate himselfLiterally “his soul”?
ul.li1: To bow his head like a reed,
ul.li2: and makeLiterally “he makes” his bed on sackcloth and ashes;
ul.li1: you call this a fast
ul.li2: and a day of pleasure to Yahweh?
ul.li1: 6Is this not the fast I choose: to release the bonds of injustice,
ul.li2: to untie the ropes of the yoke,
ul.li1: and to let the oppressed go free,
ul.li2: and tearLiterally “you must tear” every yoke to pieces?
ul.li1: 7Is it not to break your bread for the hungry?
ul.li2: You must bring homeLiterally “a house” the poor, the homeless.
ul.li1: When you see the naked, you must cover him,
ul.li2: and you must not hide yourself from your relatives.Literally “flesh”
ul.li1: 8Then your light shall break forth like the dawn,
ul.li2: and your healing shall grow quickly.
ul.li1: And your salvation shall go before you;
ul.li2: the glory of Yahweh will be your rear guard.
ul.li1: 9Then you shall call, and Yahweh himself will answer.
ul.li2: You shall cry for help, and he will say, ‘Here I am!’
ul.li1: If you remove from among you the yoke,
ul.li2: the finger-pointingLiterally “stretching out of the finger” and evil speech,Literally “the speaking of evil”
ul.li1: 10ifOr “and” you offer your soul to the hungry,
ul.li2: and you satisfy the appetite of the afflicted,
ul.li1: thenOr “and” your light shall rise in the darkness,
ul.li2: and your darkness will be like noon.
ul.li1: 11And Yahweh will lead you continually, and satisfy your soul in a barren land,
ul.li2: and he will strengthen your bones,
ul.li1: and you shall be like a well-watered garden,
ul.li2: and like a spring of water whose water does not fail.
ul.li1: 12And they shall rebuild ancient ruins from you;
ul.li2: you shall erect the foundations of many generations,Literally “generation and generation”
ul.li1: and you shall be calledLiterally “shall be called to you” the bricklayer of the breach,
ul.li2: the restorer of paths to live in.
ul.li1: 13If you hold your foot back from the Sabbath,
ul.li2: from doing your affairs on my holy day,Literally “the day of my holiness”
ul.li1: ifOr “and” you call the Sabbath a pleasure,
ul.li2: the holy day of Yahweh honorable,
ul.li1: ifLiterally “and” you honor him more thanLiterally “from” doing your ways,
ul.li2: than finding your affairsHebrew “affair” and speaking a word,
ul.li1: 14then you shall take your pleasure inOr “on” Yahweh,
ul.li2: and I will make you ride upon the heights of the earth,
and I will feed you the heritage of Jacob your ancestor,Or “father”

chapter.p: for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken.”
